posts.post_content:
Wow...what great art...oh wait, I'm NOT a fourteen-year-old girl! FAIL!  
  
\*\*\*  
  
I said on [Barony Vampire](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Barony Vampire)'s comments that these two cards need to swap art. Her looks and her stance make her look sort of coy and flirty, but in a cold, vampiric way (how you'd imagine a "Captivating Vampire").   
  
THIS dude, on the other hand, fits Barony Vampire's flavor text remarkably well. His whole mien exudes the "creepy, bad-touch predator" thing that BV's text seems to imply. I'd definitely not let this guy within 1000 feet of an elementary school.
posts.html:

THIS dude, on the other hand, fits Barony Vampire's flavor text remarkably well. His whole mien exudes the "creepy, bad-touch predator" thing that BV's text seems to imply. I'd definitely not let this guy within 1000 feet of an elementary school.

God I hate this card.
  
It's got one of the most... Disturbing artworks I've seen in a while,
  
It gives Vampires instant, unconditional benefits, only for 3 CMC this time,
  
And now I have to worry about having my own creatures being part of the Twilight army.
  
Ugh, just a really annoying artwork with more annoying vampire stuff.
  
   
EDIT
  
I'm not saying it's bad, I'm saying it's pretty damn good.
  
I'm just annoyed 'cause I'm the one going against him.

Posted By: BiOhyBr (8/30/2010 9:36:40 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
I am actually gonna stray from the pack here and say that I like this art, and I'm not a Twilight fan, or a girl. It's just well drawn, and captures the flavor. What else is art supposed to be?  
  
As for the card....you guys that are complaining about having 5 vamps out aren't doing something right. He has never, EVER hit the table for me in Standard, and not taken somebody's creatures, usually right then (and yes, he can do it right then. Read the rulings.). In fact, I actually took somebody's Captivating Vampire once. That was funny. And game.  
  
I actually took out 2 Nocturni so I could bump my count to 3. Fixed my mana curve a lot (I also made room for some Duress at the same time), gave me much more stability (I lost too many games topdecking lands with VN), and put me in a great position for Scars ( the other 2 Nocturni are my only rotating cards).
posts.html:
I am actually gonna stray from the pack here and say that I like this art, and I'm not a Twilight fan, or a girl. It's just well drawn, and captures the flavor. What else is art supposed to be?

As for the card....you guys that are complaining about having 5 vamps out aren't doing something right. He has never, EVER hit the table for me in Standard, and not taken somebody's creatures, usually right then (and yes, he can do it right then. Read the rulings.). In fact, I actually took somebody's Captivating Vampire once. That was funny. And game.

I actually took out 2 Nocturni so I could bump my count to 3. Fixed my mana curve a lot (I also made room for some Duress at the same time), gave me much more stability (I lost too many games topdecking lands with VN), and put me in a great position for Scars ( the other 2 Nocturni are my only rotating cards).

posts.post_content:
Contrary to popular belief this guy is pretty good, I like a couple of these in my vamp deck letting me swing for 14 on turn 4 instead of 12 and not giving my opponent a turn to find an answer for [nocturnus](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=nocturnus).  
  
and as to his ability, he's a permanent so he can take [emrakul](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=emrakul)  
  
and screw twilight, we have another pop culture reference to vamps that I much prefer: True Blood, let the true vamps rip out their sparkly spines.

Posted By: Gezus82 (8/23/2010 12:11:09 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
On constructed: Nocturnus is better. Since you want to drop both lords after you have a few vamps, Nocturnus' one extra mana is entirely a boon, as it gives him a superior 3/3 body. And while yes, [Vampire Nocturnus](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Vampire Nocturnus)' ability was conditional, it granted both more power and, most importantly, evasion. As for the activated ability that Nocturnus lacks, I'll respond @ benegade: Have you ever actually *tested* that? Don't you know how hard it is to get two vamps to stick for Feast of Blood, let alone FIVE? Any good constructed deck will be equipped with the removal necessary to disrupt your cluster of vamps, and then where are you? In want of Nocturnus. I can only see this being played as a deck's fifth Vamp lord.
  
On limited: This isn't exactly the rare you want to see when you open your pack, but picking him up mid-pack is huge. Grey Ogres are always acceptable, and if this guy is pumping a team of Barony Vamps, you are going to win a lot of games.
  
Miscellaneous:... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
posts.html:
On constructed: Nocturnus is better. Since you want to drop both lords after you have a few vamps, Nocturnus' one extra mana is entirely a boon, as it gives him a superior 3/3 body. And while yes, Vampire Nocturnus' ability was conditional, it granted both more power and, most importantly, evasion. As for the activated ability that Nocturnus lacks, I'll respond @ benegade: Have you ever actually tested that? Don't you know how hard it is to get two vamps to stick for Feast of Blood, let alone FIVE? Any good constructed deck will be equipped with the removal necessary to disrupt your cluster of vamps, and then where are you? In want of Nocturnus. I can only see this being played as a deck's fifth Vamp lord.
On limited: This isn't exactly the rare you want to see when you open your pack, but picking him up mid-pack is huge. Grey Ogres are always acceptable, and if this guy is pumping a team of Barony Vamps, you are going to win a lot of games.
